ticket.title: Date select helpers should have a :prompt option
ticket.original-body:
It should be possible to include a custom :prompt with the date helpers in the same way you can include one with collection_select.
Including a prompt as the first select option is common practice when using date selects. Without this feature it's very tricky to use the date helpers if you need a custom prompt.
I've included a patch with tests and documentation. With this patch you can pass custom prompts as a hash, or pass true for a generic prompt (Day, Month, Year, Hour, Minute, Seconds).
Example:
@@@ date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt=>true) date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt=>{:day=>'Select day', :month=>'Select month', :year=>'Select year'}) @@@
http://github.com/samoli/rails/commit/0d22364979bd882562035009a55e55efb1773385

I've included a patch with tests and documentation. With this patch you can pass custom prompts as a hash, or pass true for a generic prompt (Day, Month, Year, Hour, Minute, Seconds).

Example:

date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt=>{:day=>'Select day', :month=>'Select month', :year=>'Select year'})

http://github.com/samoli/rails/c...

It should be possible to include a custom :prompt with the date select helpers in the same way you can include one with collection_select.
Including a prompt as the first select option is common practice when using date selects. Without this feature it's tricky to use the date select helpers if you need a custom prompt.
I've included a patch with tests and documentation. With this patch you can pass custom prompts as a hash, or pass true for a generic prompt (Day, Month, Year, Hour, Minute, Seconds).
Example:
@@@ date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt=>true) date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt=>{:day=>'Select day', :month=>'Select month', :year=>'Select year'}) @@@

version.body-html:
It should be possible to include a custom :prompt with the date select helpers in the same way you can include one with collection_select.

Including a prompt as the first select option is common practice when using date selects. Without this feature it's tricky to use the date select helpers if you need a custom prompt.

I've included a patch with tests and documentation. With this patch you can pass custom prompts as a hash, or pass true for a generic prompt (Day, Month, Year, Hour, Minute, Seconds).

Example: 

date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt=>true)
date_select("post", "written_on", :prompt=>{:day=>'Select day', :month=>'Select month', :year=>'Select year'})

http://github.com/samoli/rails/c...

version.title: Date select helpers should have a :prompt option

version.body:
add_prompts_to_date_helpers_2.3.0.diff doesn't entirely fix this issue when applied to 2.2.2. It still uses today as default value instead of nil.
In date_helper.rb, in class InstanceTag
private def default_datetime(options) return if options[:include_blank]
should be changed to
private def default_datetime(options) return if options[:include_blank] || options[:prompt]
I haven't tested against the latest edge yet, but I'd be surprised if it works properly there.
version.body-html:
add_prompts_to_date_helpers_2.3.0.diff doesn't entirely fix this issue when applied to 2.2.2. It still uses today as default value instead of nil.

In date_helper.rb, in class InstanceTag

  private
    def default_datetime(options)
      return if options[:include_blank]

should be changed to

  private
    def default_datetime(options)
      return if options[:include_blank] || options[:prompt]

I haven't tested against the latest edge yet, but I'd be surprised if it works properly there.
version.title: Date select helpers should have a :prompt option

version.body: This new patch applies the suggested change from Martijn and updates the tests to cover this issue.
version.body-html: This new patch applies the suggested change from Martijn and updates the tests to cover this issue.
version.title: Date select helpers should have a :prompt option

version.body:
Another minor but ugly issue that remains is that when I use the "year" select box, it starts at dates in the distant past. I want those to be available, but they're not the obvious choices.
I'm not sure what the best fix would be here, though. Perhaps reversing the order of the years? Or putting the prompt (with nil value) at the bottom instead of the top? How much control does a developer currently have over such things?
version.body-html:
Another minor but ugly issue that remains is that when I use the "year" select box, it starts at dates in the distant past. I want those to be available, but they're not the obvious choices.

I'm not sure what the best fix would be here, though. Perhaps reversing the order of the years? Or putting the prompt (with nil value) at the bottom instead of the top? How much control does a developer currently have over such things?
version.title: Date select helpers should have a :prompt option

version.body: This is a good point but I think that it might be taking it a bit too far. You can always create your own helper to get absolute control. The :prompt option is fairly fundamental and is used in other select helpers so it's a natural inclusion. Maybe you could open a new ticket for this suggestion.
version.body-html: This is a good point but I think that it might be taking it a bit too far. You can always create your own helper to get absolute control. The :prompt option is fairly fundamental and is used in other select helpers so it's a natural inclusion. Maybe you could open a new ticket for this suggestion.
version.title: Date select helpers should have a :prompt option

version.body: Could this ticket be re-opened as it's not quite working in edge (see my last patch)?

version.title: Date select helpers should have a :prompt option

version.body:
+1 - we are currently running on a patched version of Rails for this fix. We are required to use custom prompts in our date selects. Is there any way we could this fix in 2.3?
Thanks!
version.body-html:
+1 - we are currently running on a patched version of Rails for this fix. We are required to use custom prompts in our date selects. Is there any way we could this fix in 2.3?

Thanks!

version.title: Date select helpers should have a :prompt option

version.body:
(from [f04346d8b999476113d5e5a30661e07899e3ff80]) Stops date select helpers from defaulting the selected date to today if :prompt option has been used
Signed-off-by: Michael Koziarski <michael@koziarski.com> [#561 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f04346d8b999476113d5e5a30661e07899e3ff80

(from [f04346d8b999476113d5e5a30661e07899e3ff80]) Stops date select helpers from defaulting the selected date to today if :prompt option has been used
